cations, my theory
would absolutely break down.
A system  which  meets  Darwin’s  criterion  is  one  which  exhibits  irre-
ducible complexity. By irreducible complexity I mean a single system which
is composed of several interacting parts that contribute to the basic function,
and where the removal of any one of the parts causes the system to effec-
tively cease functioning. An irreducibly complex system cannot be produced
directly by slight, successive modification of a precursor system, sinc
